pros: Overall good company. They try to do their best.
cons: Poor management. Poor staffing. Dangerous. Little to no training.

pros: So many , happy to be here
cons: None, it’s great working here

pros: The people at YSS truly care about the work they do and it shows
cons: While I did not receive benefits, many of my coworkers felt that the benefits were not that good.

pros: Great mission but that's about it!
cons: Bad leadership starting at the top. Bring back George!

review_title: YSS puts youth and families first
job_title: Development Coordinator in Des Moines, IA
pros:
One of the most exciting parts of working at YSS is being able to do mission driven work that makes a difference in the lives of at-risk youth. The non-profit is small enough that you can truly see the impact you have on a day to day basis and the CEO and senior leadership always make time to hear your concerns and feedback.

Most everyone that is employed at YSS wants to be here - and it shows!
cons: Since the agency has such a wide reach depending on your job that might include the occasional travel. There is also a lot of new exciting projects and facilities like the Youth Recovery Campus in Story County, the renovated Francis Lauer campus in Cerro Gordo County and the Rooftop Gardens in Polk County. If you are a self starter, good with change and a few growing pains here and there this is a good fit for you.

pros: Lots of support, Great mission, Decent facilities
cons: Attendance at sessions can be spotty given our clientele

review_title: YSS is where I've dedicated my life's work
pros: Services and programs that make a real difference in our community. Forward thinking, caring, and dedicated social service professionals who create hope and opportunity.  Friendly, helpful, and fun colleagues make the work fresh and enjoyable every day.  As a whole, YSS is ambitious and isn't afraid to take the lead when an opportunity arises. I'm happy to have been here 25 + years.  I started entry-level, lowest paid, and took advantage of every opportunity given to me for professional growth.  You want to make a difference in the lives of others? Start here at YSS.
cons: Some positions require hours outside of a typical "9-5:00" workday, but that's what it takes sometimes.  This line of work can be difficult, stressful, and tiresome as you'll work with a challenging population with high need --  not everyone can rise up to that opportunity.

pros: Great place to grow, change and work.
cons: limited resources to sustain good employees

pros: Starting at the top with our CEO, everyone at YSS is genuinely passionate about our mission and wants to make a difference in our communities. The leadership team is always looking for ways to move forward, address/fix issues, and expand our reach to help even more youth and families. I am part of a supportive, passionate team of people who are also fun and kind. They make me want to go to work each day. I can count on everyone I work with to not only do their part, but also step up if someone needs help. I love the work I do, and I feel like I'm making an impact. I've worked at other nonprofits, and YSS stands out as an organization that truly cares.
cons: With 30+ programs and six locations, there's always a lot happening. Sometimes it's hard to balance the day-to-day priorities with long-term goals.

review_title: Purposeful work and true work-life balance
pros:
The people here are phenomenal - kind, passionate, and committed. It's not unusual to find team members who have been here for decades, still loving what they do.
Work-life balance is not a saying here; it's truly the way we function. Everyone works hard and gets what they need to done, but in balance with everything that comes with life outside of work. I have worked many places, and YSS has the best real-life practices I've ever seen.
cons:
YSS is a big agency with a lot of programs so there is always a lot to do - it can be hard to prioritize everything.
Like all non-profits, YSS often cannot compete on pay - it's hard to ask people to take a pay cut to do meaningful work, but that's often what we must do.

job_title: Communications & Development Coordinator in Mason City, IA
pros:
I wake up every day excited to go to work. Not only because I enjoy my co-workers and the tasks I do, but because I truly feel like I'm making a difference.

The people, the purpose, and the opportunities at YSS make this organization a 5-star place to work in my book.
cons: While the pay isn't high, it's fair for the job and management works to compensate and support staff in a multitude of ways. I didn't come to a non-profit to make money. I came here to make a difference, and I go home every night feeling like I am.

review_title: Caring and committed staff, good agency support, accesses the most needing populations
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Ames, IA
pros:
This is an agency that truly seeks to meet needs of the community, targeting populations that are often overlooked or under-served (common client influences include identifying as GLBTQIA , parenting struggles, substance use, generational and/or relational traumas, culture of poverty, adoption, foster placement). It is one of the few community mental health organizations that welcomes and values Medicaid clients equally and utilizes grant money to be able to work with any interested client, regardless of insurance status. In many communities served, therapists are able to go directly into the schools to access students on their turf and with the least disruption to their life. Because YSS has a variety of diverse programs, it offers heightened opportunity for collaboration and consultation for setting meaningful and wraparound interventions. Therapy work with clients of YSS is meaningful and encouraging. 

YSS has offered financial supports and flexibility to it's staff throughout the COVID pandemic. They are very willing to work around staff availabilities and safety precautions. I was able to drop to part time status for periods of time that my family/life demands created the need for new balance. Therapists are able to identify hours they are willing/available to work and clinic staff schedule to match them with needs and to utilize their time. The agency also has a generous PTO plan for valuing staff self care and family/self obligations. 

Staff are uniformly oriented towards missions for creating a welcoming environment of acceptance and nonjudgement. Staff practice patience, respect and professionalism with clients and their families. YSS connects newly licensed therapists quickly with free supervision to grow the community impact and availability to continue meeting needs. The agency has longstanding relationships with local schools, businesses and ISU in terms of support, involvement in community efforts and outreach (like holiday gift giving programs, the mentor program and encouraging accessibility of YSS services to potential clients.)
cons:
As with many community agencies, salaries reflect the organization's mission (which means lower return to individual therapists in order to float other programs that are mission-oriented but may not be self sustaining.) This also allows for good support staff that schedule and manage the intake paperwork/insurance submissions. In comparison to other organizations, YSS salary options seems comparable or slightly higher than other agencies. 

Staffing right now is low (following the COVID pandemic) and opportunity is limited for collaborating in person with a wide variety of experience/expertise and for personally getting to know coworkers that are local. Hopefully this changes soon and we are able to have a strong local staff team. At present, YSS has encouraged consultations to be telehealth and across counties/regions in Iowa (rather than just our local staff in clinic locations) to connect the variety of perspectives and professional experiences.

review_title: Great place to make connections and grow!
job_title: Community Engagement Coordinator in Ames, IA
pros: I value connection and growth, so working at an organization that 1. offers opportunities to grow, 2. has a culture that supports balancing work and personal time, 3. is a place where leaders provide clarity and support to their team, has been incredible. I started in direct care and the opportunities for growth at YSS led me to find my passion - building relationships with people and connecting them with opportunities to make an impact in the lives of others.
cons: Some of the tenured staff are reluctant to change.

pros: High standard and commitment are plant here
cons: Rule and regulation is quite plenty all area

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Ames, IA
pros:
- Plenty of clients and plenty of experience. 
- Great if you enjoy working with children and/or families.
- Pay is very good for a first time therapist job, whether full time or part time.
- Work/life balance is great! If you are not scheduled to see clients, they do not expect you to be at the office keeping a seat warm.
cons:
- The management is a mess, and they handle conflicts between employees and discipline for employees in a very disorganized and unprofessional manner. On several occasions, I was chewed out by someone not in my direct line of management, and when I reported the behavior was told to not worry about it and carry on.
- Training is poor. You will often find yourself confronted with or in trouble for situations you were not trained for, and you will likely be blamed for not having the proper training. 
- Management is overworked, and so the chances of you getting help or advice when needed is next to zip. Chances are the person you need to talk to will be gone. 
- Therapists are required to attend mandatory trainings for unrelated areas, such as dealing with children in a shelter environment.
- Depending on your supervisor, you may end up with someone who, instead of letting you know what you need to work on will act out in a passive aggressive manner.

job_title: Marketing Communications Coordinator in Ames, IA
pros:
- work life balance
- flexible schedule
- the culture is great
-everyone is super nice and fun to work with
cons: Some older staff are a little set in their ways and are resistant to change.

review_title: I love doing work that I feel proud to be a part of!
job_title: Residential Marketing Coordinator in Ames, IA
pros: Team like environment that invests in the growth of their employees!
cons: Some jobs in our field require individuals to work non traditional hours.

pros: Flexibility, caring and dedicated co-workers, rewarding work, good benefits

job_title: Director of Marketing and Communications in Ames, IA
pros: Excellent PTO, great people who care about their work, mission-driven work that leaves me feeling good about what I do, really flexible and accommodating, family (and pet) friendly. There's opportunity for advancement for some positions, but not all.
cons: No retirement until you've been there 5 years. Health insurance is a little pricey when you include deductibles and out of pocket max costs. Pay is lower than corporate world, but I leave work every day knowing I made a difference in someone's life and that's priceless.

pros: Supportive team and colleagues who all worked well together.
cons: The pay was not the best.

pros: Good people to work with

review_title: Wonderfully diverse and family first mentality
pros: Direct supervisors are outstanding and well selected, facilities are very nice, lots of training and continuing ed. opportunities, coworkers become like family
cons: way low pay makes for high turnover, new grads coming to work at YSS either go back to get masters degree or use positions for stepping stones because they cant afford their student loans on their salaries. Pay freezes and lack of financial reward to those employees that stay on and carry the programs on their backs.

pros:
There’s so many positives about this company:
- General Organizational Culture
- Good, Caring, individuals and coworkers 
- Huge variety of work and plenty of it. 
- My team was awesome.
- The work is interesting and challenging.
- You work with people all the time and awesome people at that. 
You get to understand the entire accounting process.
cons: Nobody likes the finance team, unfortunately and the lower down you are in the structure of the organization, the less likely you’re going to be noticed for your worth or appreciated. A lot of road blocks from some superiors in the department when I was there. The finance team needed a good leader and someone to go in and redesign the structure of the department. Job duties, responsibilities positions.

pros:
It is very rewarding to work here! Most of my coworkers are great friends and really love their jobs.
Although the clients can be difficult, they really need people to care about them; this is a great place to make a difference!
cons:
The management is very disorganized and unprofessional. They are consistently late to meetings, the schedules only come out a few days in advance, and they are inconsistent with policies and procedures.
It is very emotionally taxing!

pros: Great opportunities for professional development. I learned so much here. I love the mission and the work is meaningful. Great co-workers, flexibility
cons: Very difficult to change or give ideas without getting pushback, very stressful and demanding, low pay, need better communication at all levels. I felt devalued many times in my role by staff and leadership, no opportunities for advancement

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Ames, IA

cons: There are growing pains and plenty of changes going on at the moment (hopefully for the better), there can be the odd office drama, but no more than in a typical workplace.

job_title: CWES Information Management Specialist in Ames, IA

cons: The senior leadership team does not collaborate well with each other. They spend many hours in meetings bickering and not focusing on the programs that need the most support. That results in issues not being resolved within the programs and creates a long time line of resolutions.

pros: There is a great communication among staff and between staff and clients! Everyone there is extremely helpful and kind! Being a human services organization, they understand a lot about psychology and address any issue coming up efficiency and effectively. Youth & Shelter Services, Inc. is the ideal company and working environment for someone who wants to thrive in human services organizations.
cons: The only thing I could say here is that I would wish they offered more administrative/public policy/legislative-concerned positions.

pros: Employees at all levels are committed to pursuing the mission and vision of the agency.  Opportunities for advancement and leadership positions are available if you seek them out.  Staff make a difference in the life of youth and families everyday.
cons: Wage freezes due to austere budget. Administration seems a bit “top heavy” while front line workers could be better compensated.

pros: Great coworkers and support staff!! Youth and Shelter Services has a great mission!
cons: Beware of individual in Community Youth and Development in leadership role,  this person demonstrates work place bullying at the highest level!!!  In addition the lack of planning, turns into to everyone’s emergency, but this person  is first to take the credit, or point finger if not done right! I personally was on the side of this, and also had to shield many co-workers from this person’s behavior.  This department does so many great things, but the leadership needs to be called out....

pros: It is a privilege to work at YSS. The leadership is thoughtful, smart, approachable, compassionate and mission oriented. The work that is done with youth and families at YSS makes a lasting impact on lives. Being a part of this is one of the greatest benefits of working at YSS.
cons: I have not experienced a downside to working at YSS.
